messages.message:
This is great! Looping in a few others:
1. This is another request for sharepoint (similar to Renre) - copying in @Varun Jain @Kaustubh (KD) @jtau here 
2. This is not possible right now - as all of the event calculation is done in Metronoome. I can't think of a workaround right now. We will keep this in mind as we invest in exposing more granular activity/cost reporting to the customer (do you mind adding these details to this ticket: https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-2318
3. Good data point that shows we're investing in the right direction! Copying in @jack.robbins @Jessica here for the doc STP feature that is planned. 
4. @Kaustubh (KD) @Jianqi Xing another customer we might be able to speak about for case mgmt.

@Varun Jain / @jtau can you folks comment on the nature of work being done for sharepoint? Is the scope to also support this for Build/Automation side or is this focused on search? I know that Varun mentioned that there will be list mile configuration that we need to do, just curious whether that effort will different across the product surfaces.

@Hamish lets connect on the case management piece today as well when we sync

We plan on supporting sharepoint in Q3 (at least our initial plan as one of the supported data sources) - can you clarify what the difference between build/automation and search usage would be for this? I don't think supporting sharepoint for build/automation going to be different from supporting any other data source for both build & search

yeah I agree with the second point, its just that I'm unfamiliar if there is an implementation difference in supporting a data source for Search (for example this might be read-only for current scope) and Automation (which might be write when we think about downstream integrations). So more just curious on what the scope is

This sounds like we don't have the high level architecture clear here regarding "write" back to the data source - can we get more details there? Can we set up a meeting to discuss this? @Varun Jain I know you mentioned you would set up a meeting to talk about this - did that ever happeN?
